novel coronavirus pneumonia: Viral pneumonia caused by SARS-CoV-2 infection. Characterized by bilateral peripheral ground-glass opacities, crazy-paving pattern, and posterior lung consolidation on CT. May progress to ARDS in severe cases.
common pneumonia: Community-acquired pneumonia caused by bacterial (e.g., Streptococcus pneumoniae), viral or fungal pathogens. Characterized by lung inflammation, alveolar exudation, and respiratory symptoms.
normal: Normal chest imaging - Clear lung fields with well-defined bronchovascular bundles, without consolidation, nodules, or interstitial abnormalities
